person.persName: George Washington Patterson (New York farmer, manufacturer, and politician)

body.p: New York farmer, manufacturer, and politician. Londonberry, New Hampshire, native. Married to Hannah W. Patterson. Father of Hannah W. Patterson and George W. Patterson, Jr. Graduated from Pinkerton Academy. Relocated to manufacture fanning mills Genessee County, New York, in 1818. Relocated to Leicester, New York, in 1825. Farmer and manufactured farm implements. Commissioner of highways in Leicester. Justice of the peace in Leicester. Member of the House of Representatives of New York State from 1832 to 1833 and 1835 to 1840. Member of the Whig Party. Relocated to Westfield, New York, in 1841. Land agent for the Chautauqua Land Office in 1841. Delegate to the New York Constitutional Convention in 1846. Lieutenant governor of New York from 1848 to 1850. Commissioner of New York Harbor from 1855 to 1857. Delegate to the Republican National Conventions representing New York in 1856 and 1860. Member of the Republican Party.
